page.title: 01Countryside sw of Carmarthen
page.content: Our block, on the west side of Carmarthen town, and the river Towy is rich in natural beauty, an area consisting of 3/4 agricultural land where mixed farming is carried on with emphasis on dairy farming. The remainder consists of scrubland, deciduous and coniferous woods, and marshlands, found mainly on the banks of the tidal river Towy. It is sparsely populated, comprising of one small village, the corner of a housing estate, a group of modern houses, plus farms and cottages dotted over the area. It lies seven miles from the coast, where the estuary of the Towy meets the sea. The furtherest point on our block is five miles from the market town of Carmarthen. The area is linked with Cardiff and Landon by the Fishgruard to London main line railway.
